lines.text: You see, I wanted to be a detective too. It only took brains, courage, and a gun... and I had the gun.

Say, I can be a lot of help to you, Sam. Look, here's my latest invention, right here - a camera with a keyhole lens. Takes pictures right through doors. I've been kicked out of five hotels already. How about it, Sam? Can I go to work for you? Just give me a simple "yes" or "no."
No.
Aw, but that's TOO simple!
Beautiful day, isn't it? Well, maybe it isn't so beautiful. It is day, though.
Easy, cuddles! One move and you're a dead midget!
Are you a man who's afraid of danger?
No, you can get as close as you like.
Uh oh, her schizo's about to phrenia!
I'm at my wit's end!
Yeah, I passed there an hour ago.
For the past six months, Miss Montay has been suffering from an acute form of schizophrenia, accompanied by visual aberrations and increasingly severe paranoiac delusions.
Mm-HMM! And how is she mentally?
You said you'd stick with me till your dying breath.
Yeah, and I'm getting too close to it.
I figure the only way to get the inside dope is from the outside... dope!
Nutty as a fruitcake, and with all that beautiful frosting.
You can open the mailman later.
If you bother us again, I'll personally punch you in the nose so hard it will look like other peoples' noses.
He said he was safe.
Oh, he's safe all right... I mean, he's safe all right.
But he's NOT safe! I KNOW he isn't!
No, no... He's in a terrible spot.
But I feel he's in great danger.
Yes, yes, he's in great danger... yeah, but he's safe alright. He's safe. I sound like an umpire.
Everything you touch turns to rigormortis.
I told you before, stick to watching the birdie and you'll die of old age.
Yeah, but I was cut out for this kind of life. All my life I wanted to be a hardboiled detective like Humphrey Bogart or Dick Powell or even Alan Ladd.
You come one step closer and I'll... I'll break this record into a thousand pieces! Oh... wait a minute. Who's side am I on?
Keep moving! You got a long drive back to town!
Yeah, well, let me tell YOU something!
What?
I like long drives.

[on Death Row]
No catsup? This is the worst last meal I've ever had.
That's their racket. They're trying to make people think everybody's crazy.
Yeah, but with you they had a head start.
Come on.
Wait a minute. You gotta listen to me. You gotta TRUST me, fellas. This is the biggest frame-up since "Whistler's Mother!"
You may not know this, but I wasn't always a detective. Before they pinned this murder rap on me I had one of the sweetest little set-ups in San Francisco.
A legitimate business?
Better than legitimate. It was profitable.
Nice, cheerful place. What time they bring the mummies out?
Do you care if I feel YOUR muscle, too?
No, go ahead. Look around. It's there someplace.
Oh, ho, there it is.
That's it.

[surprised and disappointed]
It's just like a woman's.

What kind of a sucker do you take me for? Just because you're a girl and... I'm a boy and you're... throwin' those big blue eyes at me and... you're lettin' me put my arms around you... you lemme hold you close... even closer... you think you can get me to do anything you want.
[They kiss]

[huskily]
What do you want, baby?
Darling, the first thing we've got to do...

[interrupting]
We're doin' it.
An hour later we were at the Poulet d'or - one of those real swanky cafés where they eat mink for breakfast.
No, you stay here, Miss Montay.
Yeah, you stay here.
These men are killers.
Yeah, then I'll stay here, too.
Back up, all of ya! I said BACK UP! Okay, then I'LL back up.

[soon to be executed]
Remember, I'm doing this without a rehearsal.
It always looked so easy in those Tarzan pictures!
Nice cheerful place - what time do they bring the mummies out?
I don't know how much more of this I can take - you've had me in hot water so long I feel like a tea bag.
Sorry we bothered you. You're not a bad guy for a foreigner.
Oh, but I'm going to be a citizen. I'm studying for my examination. Oh, uh, by the way, could either of you gentlemen tell me, who was the eighth president of the United States?

[the two policeman look baffled for a few seconds]
So long, bud.
Hey, boy, give me a hand with these bags!
Well, but this ice water, there's a blonde in 14-A who's on fire.
Cut the comedy and get these bags!
It's an emergency. She's sizzling hot.

[holding a gun on Montague]
Hurry up, or I'll fill ya' so full of holes, you'll look like a fat clarinet!

[Finds a bottle of booze inside a chandelier]
Aha! Ray Milland's been here!
